info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 18 at 3:29PM EDT until June 18 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Detroit/Pontiac MI
info.description:
At 329 PM EDT, Trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Water rescues have been reported and several area roadways are impassable. Between 2.5 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. Flash flooding is already occurring.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Trained spotters reported.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mount Clemens, Sterling Heights, Clinton, Macomb Township, Fraser, Clinton Township and Chesterfield Township.
Afternoon rainfall has concluded, but it will take additional time for water to recede. Additional thunderstorms are likely this evening which could lead to renewed flooding concerns.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
